body:
Would it suffice to introduce a `StringConversionSupport` class in `org.junit.platform.commons.support` with the following method (possibly supporting `Class<T>` and `T` as a return type)?

```java
Object convert(String source, Class<?> targetType, ClassLoader classLoader)
````
That sounds superb! I'm just not entirely sure why you need `ClassLoader` in there?

> I'm just not entirely sure why you need `ClassLoader` in there?

A custom `ClassLoader` is necessary to support use cases where classes are dynamically loaded.

A concrete example is converting from a fully-qualified class name (i.e., a `String`) to a `Class`.

We introduced `ClassLoader` arguments in numerous APIs in JUnit 5.10 to support custom `ClassLoader` arrangements. Consult the release notes for details.

----

By the way, we would likely accept `null` as the `ClassLoader` argument to imply that the default `ClassLoader` should be used.

issue.title: Introduce `ConversionSupport` in `junit-platform-commons`
